Political tensions: Political tensions between countries can make it difficult to organize a summit and reach a consensus on important issues.
Security concerns: Security concerns may arise due to the presence of leaders from different countries and cultures.
Funding issues: Funding for the summit may be a concern, as different countries may have different financial capabilities.
Logistical challenges: Organizing a summit with leaders from different countries can present logistical challenges, such as scheduling conflicts and travel arrangements.
Language barriers: Language barriers may arise between leaders from different countries, making it difficult to communicate effectively.
